meanings.definition: In a way that causes irritation or annoyance
meanings.sent1: She spoke exasperatingly slowly, making everyone impatient.
meanings.sent2: He exasperatingly tapped his foot while waiting in line.
meanings.sent3: The cat exasperatingly knocked over the same vase for the third time.
meanings.sent4: The dripping faucet exasperatingly echoed through the silent house.
meanings.sent5: The never-ending traffic jam was exasperatingly frustrating for commuters.

meanings.definition: To a degree that provokes frustration or anger
meanings.sent1: She exasperatingly tried to fix the broken toy but only made it worse.
meanings.sent2: He exasperatingly argued with his brother over the remote control.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn jar lid exasperatingly refused to open no matter how hard she tried.
meanings.sent4: The computer exasperatingly crashed right before saving the important document.
meanings.sent5: The constant interruptions exasperatingly disrupted the flow of the meeting.
